description: “The Kanyen’kehá:ka are capable of surpassing any goal which their citizens collaboratively develop and deliberately act upon.” These words were shared by our guest Tahohtharátye Joe Brant on November 15th. This event was a collaboration between the Indigenous Studies Program and the Ad Hoc MA in Indigenous Language Revitalization. Thank you to everyone who attended! Stay tuned for the upcoming article about this talk!

Thank you to everyone who joined us for the Indigenous Student Lunch and Study Session! It was wonderful sharing sandwiches, salads, coffee, sweets, and great conversations. Our monthly meet-ups will resume after the December break. Wishing all students the best of luck with exams and thesis work—you’ve got this! 🌟📚
Deep gratitude to our knowledge holder, Kenneth Deer, for sharing the Ways of Peace and enlightening us with countless other insights. You can watch the full talk on YouTube. The link is in the bio!

Congratulations to Dane Malenfant, last year’s Rathlyn Fellowship recipient, for winning the Best Poster Prize at the Montréal Neuroscience & AI Conference 2024! His exceptional project, supported by the Rathlyn Fellowship, is also being developed into a future research paper. We’re proud to support such innovative work!
